critique: This executive order pertains to a very specific situation regarding the reemployment rights of a former Federal Communications Commission employee who is now working for the International Telecommunication Union. It modifies a previous executive order to extend the period within which this employee can be terminated without prejudice to his reemployment rights. Given the limited scope and specific nature of this order, it's difficult to assign strong biases along the given axes. It doesn't seem to have a significant impact on ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The modification seems administrative in nature.
